sen.j: 火前坊（かぜんぼう）は、鳥山石燕の妖怪画集『今昔百鬼拾遺』にある日本の妖怪。
sen.e: Kazenbo' is a type of Japanese yokai (apparition) described in "Konjaku Hyakki Shui", a yokai (supernatural bestiaries, ghost, spirits and monsters) art collection book of Sekien TORIYAMA
sen.cmt: 妖怪画集『今昔百鬼拾遺』 参考ＨＰ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Konjaku_Hyakki_Sh%C5%ABi
sen.e: Kazenbo' (literally, a bonze in front of the fire) is a type of Japanese yokai (ghosts, spirits and monsters) described in "Konjaku Hyakki Shui" (literally, Supplement to The Hundred Demons from the Present and the Past), a yokai art collection book or a supernatural bestiary by Sekien TORIYAMA.
sen.cmt: 表現調整、パンクチュエーション、文法、書名英訳補足
sen.e: Kazenbo (literally, a bonze in front of the fire) is a type of Japanese yokai (ghosts, spirits and monsters) described in "Konjaku Hyakki Shui" (literally, Supplement to The Hundred Demons from the Present and the Past), a yokai art collection book or a supernatural bestiary by Sekien TORIYAMA.

sen.j: 平安時代頃に葬送地として知られた京都府の鳥部山に現れるという妖怪である。
sen.e: Kazenbo' appeared in Toribe-yama mountain in Kyoto Prefecture known as a funeral place in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The 'Kazenbo' was believed to appear in Mount Toribe-yama (alternatively called Toribeno) in Kyoto Prefecture, which was known as an old burial place in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 表現調整。鳥部山は鳥部野、鳥辺野の別名があります。参考：http://www.kyototsuu.jp/Geography/AreaToribeno.html
sen.e: The Kazenbo was believed to appear in Mt. Toribe (alternatively called Toribeno) in Kyoto Prefecture, which was known as an old burial place in the Heian period.

sen.j: 画図では炎と煙に包まれた乞食坊主の姿で描かれている。
sen.e: In the art book, it was portrayed as a beggar monk who was engulfed by flames and smoke.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the "Konjaku Hyakki Shui," it is portrayed as a beggar bonze who is engulfed by flames and smoke.
In the "Konjaku Hyakki Shui," it is portrayed as a beggar bonze who is engulfed by flames and smoke.

sen.j: 鳥部山は有力な皇族や貴族が葬られており、10世紀末頃には高僧たちがこの地で焚死往生を願って自らの体に火を放って命を絶ったといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that powerful members of the Imperial Family and the nobility were buried in Toribe-yama mountain and in the end of the 10th century, venerable monks burned themselves to death because they wanted to carry out 'funshi ojo' (they die in the fire, but after death, they become a Buddha).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that powerful members of the Imperial Family and the nobility were buried in Mount Toribe-yama, and in the end of the 10th century venerable monks reportedly burned themselves to death, hoping to attain 'funshi ojo' (according to their Buddhist beliefs, it was a way to become a Buddha after death).

It is said that powerful members of the Imperial Family and the nobility were buried in Mount Toribe-yama, and in the end of the 10th century venerable monks reportedly burned themselves to death, hoping to attain 'funshi ojo' (according to their Buddhist beliefs, it was a way to become a Buddha after death).

sen.j: その信仰儀式を一目見ようとする庶民たちも多かったが、中には儀式に反し、現世に未練があるなどして極楽往生できなかった者もいたとされている。
sen.e: A lot of ordinary people wanted to see the religious ritual, but some monks opposed the ritual and they did not die a peaceful death because they were attached to their life on the earth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many lay people wanted to see this religious ritual of self-cremation, and it was assumed that despite the ritual, some monks did not die a peaceful death because they were attached to the life on the earth.
sen.cmt: 原文「人目」は「一目」の誤りと思われますので修正してあります。なお、「～多かったが」は逆接になっていますが、後半とのつながりが逆接では意味が通らない為、順接andに置き換えています。また、「儀式に反し」の部分ですが、「儀式に反抗し」というよりは「儀式とは裏腹に」と解釈して訳出し直しました。
sen.e: Many lay people wanted to see this religious ritual of self-cremation, and it was assumed that despite the ritual, some monks did not die a peaceful death because they were attached to the life on the earth.

sen.j: そうした僧の霊が僧形の怪火となって鳥部山に現れたものが火前坊とされている。
sen.e: The souls of those monks appeared in Toribe-yama mountain in the shape of mysterious fiery apparition, which is called 'Kazenbo'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The souls of those failed Buddhas supposedly appeared in Mount Toribe-yama in the form of the mysterious fiery apparition, which was therefore called Kazenbo.
The souls of those failed Buddhas supposedly appeared in Mt. Toribe in the form of the mysterious fiery apparition, which was therefore called Kazenbo.
